featured.text: In his resignation speech, he blamed his failings on the fact that he was blood type B. The blood-type craze, considered simply harmless fun by some Japanese, may manifest itself as prejudice and discrimination.
At the close of the 15th century, Europeans’ craze for spices gave rise to the Spice Route, a network of sea lanes joining Europe with the Far East, where most spices came from.
The craze for hoops even resulted in dislocated backs and heart attacks, according to medical records.

definition.zh_def: 狂熱，熱潮；一種短暫的流行或熱情。
definition.en_def: A temporary and intense enthusiasm or passion for something.
definition.example: The new smartphone model created a craze among tech enthusiasts.
